gurmukhi: iqn miRqk krm ]niRp krm Drm ]bhu byd rIq ]ik`nI su pRIq ]88]
transliteration: Tin Mritak Karam|| Nrip Karam Dharma|| Bahu Bed Reet|| Kinnisu Preet||88||
translation: Then the king performed the last funeral rites of all affectionately according to Vedic injunctions.88.

gurmukhi: niRp puqR sog ]gXo surg log ]niRp By su jOn ]kiQ sky kOn ]89]
transliteration: Nrip Poutra Sog|| Gyo Surag Log|| Nrip Bhe Su Jaoun|| Kath(i) Sake Kaoun||89||
translation: In his extreme sorrow on the demise of his sons, the king left for heaven and after him, there were several other kings; who can describe them?89.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy bHmw Avqwr ibAws rwjw piRQ ko rwj smwpqM ]
transliteration: It(i) Bachitra Naatak Granthe Brahmaa Avtaar Biaas Raajaa Prith Ko Raaj Samaaptan||
translation: End of the description of Vyas, the incrnation of Brahma and the rule of king Prithu in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: AQ jujwq rwjw ko rwj kQnM ]
transliteration: Ath Jujaat Raajaa Ko Raaj Kathanan||
translation: Now begins the description about king Yayati

gurmukhi: pun BXo jujwq ]soBw ABwq ]ds cwr vMq ]soBw suBMq ]90]
transliteration: Poun Bhyo Jujaat|| Sobhaa Abhaat|| Das Chaar Vant|| Sobhaa Soubhant||90||
translation: Then there was a most glorious king Yayati, whose fame had spread in the fourteen worlds.90.

gurmukhi: suMdr su nYx ]jn rUp mYx ]soBw Apwr ]soBq suDwr ]91]
transliteration: Soundar Su Nain|| Jan Roop Main|| Sobhaa Apaar|| Sobhat Sudhaar||91||
translation: His eyes were charming and his form of enormous glory was like the god of love.91.

gurmukhi: suMdr srUp ]soBMq BUp ]ds cwr vMq ]soBw ABMq ]92]
transliteration: Soundar Daroop|| Sobhant Bhoop|| Das Chaar Vant|| Aabhaa Abhant||92||
translation: The fourteen worlds had received brilliance from the glory of his charming elegance.92.

gurmukhi: gun gn Apwr ]suMdr audwr ]ds cwr vMq ]soBw suBMq ]93]
transliteration: Goun Gad Apaar|| Soundar Udaar|| Das Chaar Vant|| Sobhaa Soubhant||93
translation: That generous king had innumerable qualities and had skill in fourteen science.93.

gurmukhi: Dn gun pRbIn ]pRB ko ADIn ]soBw Apwr ]suMdr kumwr ]94]
transliteration: Dhan Foun Prabeen|| Prabh Do Adheen|| Sobhaa Apaar|| Soundar Koumaar||94||
translation: That beautiful king was most glorious, capable, expert in qualities and had faith in God.94.

gurmukhi: SwsqR`g su`D ]kRoDI su ju`D ]niRp BXo byn ]jnu kwmDyn ]95]
transliteration: Shaastragg Suddh|| Krodhisu Juddh|| Nrip Bhayo Ben|| Jan(u) Kaamdhen||95||
translation: The king had knowledge of Shastras; he was extremely furious in war; he was the fulfiller of all wishes like Kamadhenu, the wish-fulfilling cow.95.

gurmukhi: KUnI su K`g ]joDw AB`g ]K`qRI AKMf ]kRoDI pRcMf ]96]
transliteration: Khoonisu Khagg|| Jodhaa Abhagg|| Khattri Akhannddkrodhiprachanndd||96||
translation: The king with his bloody dagger was and invincible, complete, furious and powerful warrior.96.

gurmukhi: sqRUix kwl ]kwFI kÍwl ]sm qyj Bwn ]jÍwlw smwn ]97]
transliteration: Satroonv Kaal|| Kaadhikravaal|| Sam Tej Bhaan|| Jvlaalaa Samaan||97||
translation: When he drew his sword, he was like KAL (death) for his enemies; and his magnificence was like the fires of the sun.97.
